examples: There are only ten of these rare animals left.
ten of Sweden’s top financial experts
Twelve people were invited but only ten turned up.
Do you have change for ten dollars?
I can't read your writing—is this meant to be a ten?
The bulbs are planted in sevens or tens (= groups of seven or ten).
We moved to America when I was ten (= ten years old).
Shall we meet at ten (= at ten o'clock), then?

meanings.def: used to say that somebody has guessed something correctly or done something very well
examples: Not brilliant, Robyn, but I'll give you ten out of ten for effort.
Ten to one he'll be late.

meanings.def: very common and therefore not valuable
examples: Teachers of history are ten a penny.

idioms.def: used to say that somebody has guessed something correctly or done something very well
examples: Not brilliant, Robyn, but I'll give you ten out of ten for effort.
Ten to one he'll be late.

idioms.def: very common and therefore not valuable
examples: Teachers of history are ten a penny.

related: not touch somebody/something with a ten-foot pole
give a hundred (and ten) per cent
